description.narrative: By 2022, the education system provides holistic and child-centred learning and development in primary schools., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls and boys aged 5-9, especially the most deprived, benefit from healthy, nurturing, protective environments and live free from violence.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - teacher development, management, and support

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the education system provides holistic and child-centred learning and development in primary schools.

description.narrative: Focus continues on increasing the quality of learning outcomes in Primary Education by creating a conducive learning environment through key identified areas such as: strengthening pedagogy, revising curriculum and creating safe learning spaces, in partnership with the provincial and national level stakeholders. Engagement in the general education reform process continues with consultancy support being proposed for curriculum and pedagogy reforms. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:25/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of schools with primary sections in targeted provinces implementing the multilevel pedagogy model

actual.value: 2020:0 new schools were added this year to date. However with the the learning recovery in Uva and Central all the schools in the provinces will be implementing ML.

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Teachers - The quality of national systems for school leadership - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Score 1: School leadership: Principals' training and job descriptions require them to focus on administrative tasks.

actual.value: 2019:Score 1: A shift towards encompassing instructional leadership has been introduced by the Govt.

title.narrative: System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Score 3: Classroom Assessment. There is sufficient system-wide institutional capacity to support and ensure the quality of school-based classroom assessment practices, including in early grades. The inspection and supervision system is sufficient. There is a formal system-level document that provides guidelines for classroom assessment. There are some system-level mechanisms to ensure that teachers develop skills in classroom assessment. There are limited systematic mechanisms to monitor the qua

actual.value: 2019:Score 3: Formal assessment systems exist but teacher capacity development and governance needs to improve
